question_text: A 46-year-old man is evaluated following an episode of nephrolithiasis. He has yet to pass the kidney stone.Urinalysis results are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely composition of this patient's kidney stone?
critique: The most likely stone composition is uric acid (Option D). Uric acid crystals can take on a variety of appearances, such as rhomboids, barrels, and rosettes. Uric acid crystals can be a normal constituent of urine but are also commonly associated with uric acid nephrolithiasis or acute uric acid nephropathy.

figures.title: Urine Microscopy Showing Uric Acid Crystals
figures.short_title: Urine Microscopy Showing Uric Acid Crystals
